results.title: Fire over England
results.creator_credit: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, London Film Productions and Pendennis
results.brief_description: Historical drama dealing with England’s struggle against the Spanish Armada. Performances by Vivien Leigh, Laurence Olivier, Flora Robson and an early performance by James Mason. Based on the novel by A.E.W. Mason.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William K. Howard, Erich Pommer, London Film Productions and Pendennis

results.title: Another Country
results.creator_credit: Marek Kanievska, Alan Marshall, Castlezone and Goldcrest
results.brief_description: Guy Bennett is nearing the end of his last year at a leading English boarding school. His best friend, Tommy Judd, is a Marxist, committed to Lenin’s brave new world. In a school permeated by homosexuality, affairs between the boys are accepted, provided discretion is practised. Bennett breaks this unwritten rule and the humiliating consequences establish within him a rejection of the system that excludes him. Scripted by Julian Mitchell from his own play.

results.title: The Big Sleep
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Raymond Chandler’s novel of the same name, “The Big Sleep” stars Humphrey Bogart as Philip Marlowe, the private eye who “dares to walk the mean streets alone”. Investigating a series of gambling debts he comes across plenty of murder, blackmail, kidnapping and violence. Lauren Bacall plays opposite Bogart and the screen magic between them in this film is legendary. The witty dialogue is scripted by William Faulkner. A consummate Hollywood film noir.

results.title: Swann in Love = Un Amour de Swann
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Eberhard Junkersdorf, Margaret Menegoz, Nicole Stephane, Bioskop Film, Gaumont-British Instructional and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: Based on one of Marcel Proust’s stories from “Remembrance of things past”, the film tells the story of Charles Swann’s obsessively jealous passion for the socially unsuitable Odette de Crecy. Stars Jeremy Irons, Alain Delon and Ornella Muti.

results.title: The Wrong Man
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Herbert Coleman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A tense thriller based on the true story of an honest man mistaken for an armed robber. When Christopher Balestrero (Henry Fonda) decides to borrow money on his wife’s insurance policy to pay urgent debts, a tragic chain of events is set off because the staff of the insurance company believe him to be a man who previously held up their office.

results.title: Come in spinner
results.creator_credit: Robert Marchand, Jan Chapman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: It is October 1944, and the Pacific War has brought American forces to Sydney, turning it into a gaudy garrison town. The gamblers and good time charlies converge on the South Pacific Hotel, Sydney’s finest. Amidst the social upheavals of war, a society is in flux, marriages are strained, values are tested. The heart of the South Pacific Hotel is the beauty salon run by three remarkable women. This is the story of one week in their lives. Based on the novel by Dymphna Cusack and Florence James.

results.title: La Dolce Vita = The Sweet life
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Giuseppe Amato and Riama Film
results.brief_description: A look at the decadent lifestyle of Roman high society, seen through the eyes of a gossip columnist who aspires to straight journalism, but is unable to break away from his debauched life. “La Dolce Vita” still remains one of the most popular of all Fellini’s films. Cast includes Marcello Mastroianni and Anita Ekberg. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Manon des Sources
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Second and concluding part of the story based on the novel by Marcel Pagnol that began with “Jean de Florette”. This part, taking place ten years later, deals with the revenge inflicted by Jean’s daughter on those responsible for his death. An absorbing tale that makes its leisurely way to an unexpected climax. Stars Daniel Auteuil, Yves Montand and Emmanuelle Beart.

results.title: The Best of...What's Left of...Not Only but Also...The Video
results.creator_credit: Dick Clement, James Gilbert, Joe McGrath, John Street and BBC
results.brief_description: After 20 years apart, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore reunite and share their past memories of their comedy partnership together. We see many old comedy routines that they performed together.

results.title: Go West
results.creator_credit: Edward Buzzell, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers go to America’s wild west where the man who gets the deed to Dead Man’s Gulch gets rich. Groucho, Chico and Harpo go west in search of the deed. Filled with typical Marx Brothers’ lunacy, “Go West” climaxes with the wildest train chase on film. Cast also includes John Carroll, Diana lewis, Walter Woolf King, Robert Barrat.
